Generation IV.Diamond: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
Generation IV.Pearl: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey--even those taking shelter behind a wall.
Generation IV.Platinum: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Luxray 's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Luxray 's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

Generation VIII.Sword: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.
Generation VIII.Shield: Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of Luxray's electricity, so the Pokémon sleeps for long periods of time to store up energy.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
Generation IX.Violet: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.
